Tasks.Title: 1 - Launch the solution from Visual Studio
Tasks.Description:
Well done! If you see this output in your browser, you have already completed the first task.
Now you can start with the tasks below and mark them as done later when you have created the functionality for them.
Make sure you follow the development guidelines in the Readme.md in the root directory of this solution.
Good luck!

Tasks.Title: 2 - Editing functions - Mark task as done
Tasks.Description:
The 'Erledigt' button is used to set the task processing status to Done or Not Done.
The customizations are to be done from the WebUI (frontend) to the database (backend).

Tasks.Title: 3 - Central logging
Tasks.Description: A logging mechanism is to be introduced for all services to ensure central logging.

Tasks.Title: 4 - Central configuration
Tasks.Description: All services should be configurable via a central .ini file (http endpoint, database file, etc.).

Tasks.Title: 5 - UI extension
Tasks.Description: Extend the user interface with another tab where you can display the number of completed tasks versus the number of open tasks in a pie chart.

Tasks.Title: 6 - Refactoring to Async
Tasks.Description: Refactoring of the entire application, so that there are no more synchronous method calls to the database layer or in the rest interfaces.

Tasks.Title: 7 - Use SQLite
Tasks.Description: Use a SQLite database instead of the database.json file.

Tasks.Title: 8 - Use another WebFramework
Tasks.Description:
The aim is to rebuild the current UI in another web framework (Angular or Blazor).
Hint: Use the Task-API

Tasks.Title: 9 - Delete a Task
Tasks.Description:
The new frontend should be able to use the Task-API hosted on PIA.DotNet.Interview.Backend to delete a task.
Hint: you need to add a delete button
